results.title: Country
results.creator_credit: Richard Pearce, Jessica Lange, William D Whittliff, Far West Productions and Pangaea Corporation
results.brief_description: A deeply-felt variation of the classic struggle of the working man versus the forces of government. Iowa farmers, Jewell and Gil Ivy (Jessica Lange and Sam Shephard) work a poor farm held by their family for generations. Shephard delivers a performance of immense integrity in his portrayal of a man humiliated because he is unable to provide for his family. The screenplay reflects recent events in the US where struggling farmers took on government loans to expand and wound up faced with foreclosure on their properties.

results.title: Born yesterday
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, S. Sylvan Simon and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Classic Hollywood comedy starring Judy Holliday and William Holden. Judy’s riotous performance as Billy Dawn, the clever ‘dumb blonde’, won her the 1951 Academy Award. Billy, her shady boyfriend and all his thugs move to a Washington hotel to begin wheeling and dealing in the political scene. To get her out of his way, and make her a little more cultured, and dignified, Billy’s gangster boyfriend (Broderick Crawford) hires Holden to teach her. Hilarious scenes and famous lines dot this film which has remained unforgettably and indelibly in the minds of audiences the world over. Based on the stage play by Garson Kanin.

results.title: Sunday bloody Sunday
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Joseph Janni and Vectia Films
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson, a career woman separated from her husband, and Peter Finch, a Jewish doctor, are caught in a love triangle with a young bisexual designer. Although the arrangement appears ideal, the trio must deal with the jealousy, fear and self doubt they encounter. This absorbing character study, originally shocking, is regarded as a forerunner of cinema’s increasingly mature treatment of homosexuality. Also stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Souvenirs D'en France = Insider Memories of France
results.brief_description:
Pedret, a Spanish migrant, has built a prosperous business in which his three sons, Prosper, Hector, Victor are employed. Prosper has married a girl from the local bourgeoisie who has no interest in the factory and its problems. Hector is married to Berthe, a former laundress, whose strength of character and drive attracts the support of Pedret. He supports her in her attempts to bring in a few changes in the factory management. When WWII breaks out, Berthe refuses to imitate her family who retreats in passive neutrality and becomes heavily involved in the Resistance. Techine’s film explores the relation between history and ‘personal histories’ (the title contains a pun on ‘en France’ and ‘enfance’, childhood), focusing on a family from the 1930s to the 1970s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1975): Best Supporting Actress for Marie-France Pisier.

Credits: Producer, Vera Belmont ; director, Andre Techine ; writers, Andre Techine, Marylin Goldin ; photography, Bruno Nuytten ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Michel Auclair, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Mann, Orane Demazis.

results.title: Murder at the gallop
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “After the funeral” also published as “Funerals are fatal” by Agatha Christie. Mr Enderby, a wealthy and elderly man, dies unexpectedly and his not-so-bereaved relatives gather for the reading of the will. The speculation that he may have been murdered intensifies when another relative is slain, begging the question, “Who will be next?” Starring Margaret Rutherford, Robert Morley, Flora Robson and Stringer Davis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: L'amour Nu = Naked Love
results.creator_credit: Yannick Bellon, Adolphe Viezzi and Henri Lassa
results.brief_description:
Claire, a UNESCO interpreter, meets Simon, an oceanographer at an international conference. They fall in love and contemplate life together, but Claire finds a suspicious lump in her breast. After a few trips to the doctor, she finds out that she needs a mastectomy. Unable to announce the truth to her new boyfriend, she breaks off their relationship.

Credits: Producers, Henri Lassa, Adolphe Viezzi ; director, Yannick Bellon ; writers, Yannick Bellon, Francoise Prevost ; photography, Jean Charvein ; music, Richard de Bordeaux.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Jean-Michel Folon, Zoriza Lozic, Georges Rouquier, Hyppolite Girardot.

results.title: Clerambard
results.brief_description:
Clerambard lives on the edge of poverty in an old castle. He ekes a living out of killing cats and dogs and exploiting his family. His life is turned updside down after reading ‘The life of St Fancis of Assissi’. The Saint even appears to help Clerambard go out into the world to preach the gospel and reveal his newfound love of animals.

Credits: Producers, Yves Robert, Alain Poire ; director, Yves Robert ; writers, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Yves Robert ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Dany Carrel, Lise Delamare, Gerard Lartigau, Claude Pieplu, Roger Carel, Martine Sarcey.

results.title: fin du jour
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Filmsonar a Epinay and Regina Film
results.brief_description:
This comedy peeks in at the lives and relationships between elderly thespians living in an actors’ retirement home. The home is almost bankrupt and so the actors must support themselves. The residents include a faded sex symbol, an intellectual actor who kept a great distance between himself and the audience, and a depressed thespian who tries to conceal the fact that he was only an understudy.

Credits: Director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Charles Spaak, Julien Duvivier ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Maurice Jaubert ; art direction, Jacques Krauss.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Michel Simon, Madeleine Ozeray, Victor Francen, Gabrielle Dorziat, Sylvie.

results.title: L'ironie du Sort = Irony of Chance
results.brief_description:
Set in Nantes, during the German Occupation, the film examines a series of events and shows what might have happened if one thing had gone differently in each instance. The main protagonists are two friends, Antoine and Jean, both in love with Marie-Anne, and both actively involved with the Resistance.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writers, Edouard Molinaro, Paul Guimard, Pierre Kast ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Jose Berghams.
Cast: Claude Rich, Pierre Clementi, Marie-Helene Breillat, Jacques Spiesser, Jean Desailly

results.title: Le Passager de la Pluie = Passengers of the Rain
results.brief_description:
Melie kills the stalker who assaulted and raped her and then disposes of the body. When the body is recovered, Dobbs, an American military officer accuses Melie of the murder and of stealing the US Army money that the rapist had been carrying with him. Awards: Golden Globe 1971 for Best Foreign Film.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Rene Clement ; writers, Sebastien Japrisot, Lorenzo Ventavoli ; photography, Andreas Winding ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Charles Bronson, Annie Cordy, Jean Gaven, Gabriele Tinti, Jean Piat, Jill Ireland, Corrine Marchand.
